newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Earthquake recorded 145 km off Guam.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake recorded 145 km off Guam.

text.p: An intense earthquake was recorded 145 kilometres (90 miles) southwest of the Pacific island of Guam on Tuesday morning, the Royal Hong Kong Observatory said.

The quake, estimated to be 5.7 on the Richter scale, was recorded at 4.48 a.m. (20.48 gmt Monday). The epicentre was initially determined to be in the vicinity of the Mariana Islands about 145 km southwest of Guam at 12.6 N 143.7 E, the observatory said.
